 Not considering death as something terrifying is not the same as considering it something desirable. Assuming one's present circumcumstance are reasonable, no one wants to die. Getting one's brains blown away would not make anyone's day, even if existentially, the concept of death is not terrifying. 
 
 Some people are resigned to the understanding that you're born, you live, you die. That's it. While we are here, let's make the most of it for ourselves and everyone else. What other choice is there? What is there to seek refuge from? What kind of belief system is it that serves as refuge from unwarranted terrifying ideas? Because something really bothers me, I will choose to believe something that makes me feel better, no matter how preposterous?

I certainly have every intention of living my life as well as I can too, and I suspect you'd find most religious people would feel the same way.
